thread.title: Muhammad Ali's son detained at Florida airport and asked are you Muslim? | Metro News
thread.title_full: Muhammad Ali's son detained at Florida airport and asked are you Muslim? | Metro News

author: Nicole Morley For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Muhammad Ali's son detained at Florida airport and asked are you Muslim? | Metro News
text:
Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Saturday 25 Feb 2017 8:53 am The boxer’s son was repeatedly asked about his religion (Picture: PA) 
The son of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali was detained by immigration staff who asked –‘are you Muslim?’ 
A lawyer claims Muhammad Ali Jr, was asked targeted by immigration officials at a Florida airport who repeatedly asked about his religion and where he got his name. Girlfriend’s heartbreak as man who killed boyfriend with one punch is jailed for six years 
Chris Mancini tells the Courier-Journal in Louisville that 44-year-old Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother Khalilah Camacho-Ali, the second wife of Muhammad Ali, were arriving at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport on Feb. 7 after returning from Jamaica. 
Khalilah Camacho-Ali, who married the boxer in 1967, was in Jamaica with her son to deliver a speech on black history. The boxer’s son was detained for almost two hours (Picture: Rex)
